label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a very finely carved modillion viewed from the front and in profile.  It is a delicate bluish-gray, possibly indicating it was marble.  The front view shows the modillion with a large leaf that terminates in a scrolle.  The side view reveals the modillion curved profile begins and ends with a rosette.  The main decorative element is a long, scrolling vine with lacy leaves and a small winged creature perched on the vine.  This section has a large, oblong beaded molding.  The right side of the modillion has another decorative element in its own panel, that of a slender, tall vase with leaf ornament at the base.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with four sketches of architectural elements.  At top left is a faucet in the shape of a winged bird.  At right is the section of a door from the church of St. Anastasia.  The door is composed of rows of small tri-lobed arches, possibly painted white, and decorated by nailheads.  Below this at right is another wood door from St. Anastasia also with a creamy-white finish.  This door is ornamented by rows of carved quatrefoils with a border of half-rosettes and a diamond pattern.  Dark gray nailheads stand out in contrast.  At lower left is a section of an iron railing consisting of joined quatrefoils.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Pilaster, Certosa di Pavia, and Hanging Lamp, Sant'Anastasia, Verona

label: Description
value: Vertical sheets with two drawings.  In the center is an elaborately pierced iron lamp, like a basket, suspended from two chains made of s-shaped links that hang from a delicate leafy bracket.  Above is a pilaster drawn so that its orientation on the page is horizontal.  It is rendered in graphite without any wash, perhaps to indicate the material was marble.  The pilaster has a panel of vase-like and leafy ornament, with an elaborate capital above.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Detail and Section View of Wood Ceiling, Sacristy at St. Zeno, Verona

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet showing cross section of a wooden ceiling created by a curved upper section of wall that meets flat paneling and coffers. The drawing above is a detail of the coffered ceiling, painted in shades of yellow, blue, and salmon.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting statue of a man seated on horseback raised on a plinth mounted on a thick cornice.  The cornice is supported by Corinthian columns set on high bases.  This is all raised up on a three-part stepped rectangular base.  All elements of this monument have a greenish-gray color, as if to indicate they are made of a gray metal, or a patinated copper.  The sheet has pin holes in all four corners.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with an uneven or torn bottom edge and pinholes at all four corners.  Three lamps on pedestals at gondola landings are depicted, all in shades of green with small elements highlighted in yellow to indicate gilding.  From left, a lamp in front of the Hotel de l'Europe; in the middle, a lamp from Piazza San Marco; and at right, a lamp from the landing near the Bridge of Straw (Ponte delle Paglia).

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Plan and Elevation, Pulpit at Torcello

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a colonnaded structure with a small recessed opening visible. A carved panel and elaborately carved moldings have been sketched in the center section.  Various details have also been given letter designations which correspond to their color, which is sometimes noted in the margin to the left of this drawing.  Below is a view in plan of a circular structure with columnar supports visible.  There is another small drawing of a molding detail at center right.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  The main and best rendered of the three sketches on the sheet is the dome of San Marco, Venice, at left.  The artist has depicted the arcaded cupola and finial in great detail.  To the right are two sketches of chimneys.  Each has a narrow shaft with a trapezoidal cap.  The cap is inverted so that the widest part is at the top of the chimney stack.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard adhered to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
Lion and Pedestal, Palazzo Vecchio, Florence

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet cut down from a larger size, with pinholes at the top corners.  Depicted is the statue of a lion seated on a large pedestal seen from the side. The pedestal consists of a thick cornice supported by two inverted pillars (like balusters) at either corner.  In the center is a panel with a fleur-de-lys in a wreath and festoons of ribbons coming out from all four corners of the wreath. Other sketches on the sheet depict various details of the ornament on the pedestal, with inscriptions identifying them (clockwise from top left): cornice, architrave moulding, shield, column, pillars, fleur de lys, part of wreath, shields and festoon.  These are all tinted cream to pale beige, as if to imply marble.  The lion is a soft gray-green, implying either a patinated metal or stone surface.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Iron Lamps and Torch Bearers, Palazzo Strozzi, Florence

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with four sketches of lighting implements.  At the top left and right are two torch bearers. The one at left in the form of griffin with the head of a classical goddess which holds in her mouth a short flange that ends in a large round bobeche.   The one at right is a similar form, but instead is a  horned dragon with its spiny wing extended, and it holds a different bobeche in its mouth.  Below center is a large iron lamp in the form of a small building.  Three columns support an entablature from which three very large curved spikes rise from the corners.  The two sides that are visible have a double lancet opening and panels below.  To the right of this drawing is the bracket that supports the lamp, decorated with a lion, banner, modillions, and rosettes.  The drawings are all tinted a pinkish-gray.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet tipped horizontally into binding depicting a modillion from the front and side.  The front view has a molding of small oak leaves at the top, with the long, swooping lines of a large leaf below.  The side view of the modillion is read perpendicular to the front view.  It shows the modillion has a scroll terminating in a rosette at either end.  The field above the scroll is tinted yellow and has short, intersecting lines, as if to imply a crackled surface.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
Iron Gate and Balcony, Il Bargello, Florence

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet tipped horizontally into binding, divided into two halves.  The upper half of the sheet depicts an ironwork gate, while the lower half depicts a section of a balcony.  A corner of the gate is illustrated, showing a horizontal and vertical member intersected and an iron mesh in the center.  The links of iron have been cross-hatched, giving the impression that the metal was braided.  The top of the gate has three groups of three spiky projections.  The metal of the gate is rendered in slate blue. The drawing below shows what could be a section of the architrave of a balcony.  The lower portion has a frieze of shells inscribed in circles.  The field around the shells is bright yellow with crazed lines, mimicking a crackled surface.  Above this is another frieze separted by a beaded course.  The frieze alternates larger shells (almost like anthemion) with the heads of cherubs.  The heads are encircled by halo-like spheres.  The spheres alternate sections of three gold dots and a strip of color, as shown here, either green or blue.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with pinhole at bottom left and right corner missing. Depicted is the elevation of an architrave supported by a pilaster and paneling on a raised plinth. This is drawn so that the architrave and top of the pilaster are at the top and left side of the sheet, while the bottom half of the pilaster, the paneling, and plinth are drawn to the right.  The details of the architrave moldings have only been rendered at the left corner, but the architrave frieze of winged cherubs alternating with torches has been completed across the sheet. The frieze has a royal blue ground while the torches are bright yellow.  The frieze ends in a crowned yellow star.  The Corinthian pilaster is decorated with a festoon of greenery suspended from a yellow ring at the top of the shaft.  This ornamental festoon continues on the bottom half of the pilaster.  Only the left side of the plinth and the paneling are drawn.  The paneling appears to alternate a light marble or stone pilaster with a decorated motif - a shield or coat of arms as is illustrated here in green, yellow, and blue.  The use of color indicates the actual medium of the pilaster and architrave might be majolica or faience typical of Italian Renaissance-period decoration.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Elevation and Details of Masonry, Glass Window

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet illustrating various scaled masonry elements, a stained glass window, and another unidentified decorative architectural component.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with sketches of architectural elements.  At left is a section of a buliding, with round arch ceiling below and slanted roof above.  At top left is a detail of an Ionic capital supporting a beam.  At right an elevation of a colonnade in the Ionic style supporting a tiled roof.  Below this is an elevation of an arcade in the Ionic style.  It is possible that these sketches are elevations of the first and second stories of the building shown in section at left.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
Lion in Wood, Il Bargello Museum, Florence

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Depicted is a leaping lion clutching an orb with a fleur-de-lys.  The lion is seen from the front and also in profile.  Both sketches have very faint guide lines inscribed to assist with transfering the drawing to the sheet.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Well Head and Three Roundels, Florence

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with three sketches.  At upper left is a basin with four pieces of twisted ironwork rising above it.  These curve up and on each other, twist together, and then separate again into two lily blossoms and a third unopened blossom at the top.  Attached to the twisted section at the top is a letter S.  To the right and below are sketches of roundels or tondi depicting figures against a segmented blue ground.  The one at top right is wearing a brown wrap that is bound with white cloth or ribbon.  Below this is another roundel or tondo of similar configuration, but the wrap is teal blue.  Both of these figures have their arms outstretched.  The figure in the roundel below left only has one arm outstretched and the reddish-orange wrap is instead around the figure's feet and lower legs.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Glazed Terra Cotta at Museum Bargello, Florence

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  The sheet contains a very detailed elevation of a wall in the Bargello Museum, depicting what is likely ornament from dating to the Renaissance, possibly by members of the Della Robbia family.  The elevation consists of a cornice with a variety of molding styles, and a frieze of winged cherubs' heads connected by green festoons.  The field of the frieze is periwinkle blue, while the halos behind the cherubs are golden yello, and the festoons are green.  Below this are two niches containing figures.  Each niche is framed by Corinthian pilasters.  The figure at left is a woman wears sandals and a reddish-brown gown with a green robe draped over it.  She has golden red hair and a halo behind her. She holds a book in her left hand and a covered cup in her right.  The figure at right is a man who stands contrapposto with his chest bare and only a gray cloth around his waist.  He holds a tall crucifix in his left hand and with his right gestures to a chalice on the ground at his feet.  Each niche has a scalloped detail behind the heads of the figures.  The niches have considerable depth.  The pilasters framing them are detailed on both sides and turned so that the corner of the support faces front.  The base they stand on has two leafy moldings on either side of a stepped meander frieze in gold and blue.  To the right of this is a measured sketch giving the dimensions that correspond to each architectural level of the sculptural scene.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
Campanile of Palazzo Vecchio and Details of Ironwork, Florence

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with many small sketches of ironwork, architectural details and, the largest of the sketches, a view of the campanile of the Palazzo Vecchio as seen from the back or side.  Many of the drawings for ironwork are reddish-gray, as if to indicate rust or patina.  Two types of ironwork (possibly used for hitching a horse?) are shown from the front and in profile  There is another small ring at upper right shown in a three-quarter view and also from the side.  Many of the sketches bear notations about their scale.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
Iron Door or Gate of Staircase, Bargello, Florence

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting in great detail an iron gate.  The center of the gate is composed of lattice strips of iron.  Above and below are four square panels, though only the bottom right panel contains an openwork rosette, though it is possible that the artist implies that this is repeated both above and below. The gate has a long latch with notches at the bottom so that it can be made shorter or longer.  The latch has a small detail of a head at the end.  In the margin of the sheet are fuller renderings of details only sketched in the larger drawing.  These are a rosette; a figural nailhead seen from the front and in profile;  the side of a bracket; a section of one of the lattice pieces; a section through the door at the bottom; another figural nailhead; and other details of the ornament.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
Gate and Window Screen, Monastery (of) St. Marco, Florence

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet consisting of three main sketches, all elements of ironwork at the monastery of San Marco.  Above is a gate rendered in detail only from above and at upper right.  The gate is made up of long vertical members that have scroll ornament and terminate in a leaf-like end.  The upper section of the gate has three large connected scrolls.  This sketch is scaled.  To the right of this drawing is a sketch of the bolt that presumably locks the gate.  At bottom right is a drawing of a window screen or grille also made of iron.  Its members intersect to form a screen, while the vertical members protrude past the top of the screen and alternate ending in a leaf or fleur-de-lys.  This drawing is also scaled.  At bottom left is the top of a gate with a pod-shaped element with lobes around its sides, and it is topped by a spiky crown.  To the right of it are smaller ironwork details.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
Double Arcade in one of the Smaller Courts of the Hospital, Milan

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Depicted is the elevation of a double arcade supported by Corinthian columns.  The bottom right corner of the sheet illustrates a plan of three of these arcaded bays with columnar supports, and the artist has inscribed a note about the distance between them.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white textured wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Depcted is an elevation of a polychromed building with a double arcade of Doric columns.  A single open window is above, the wall is capped by a terra cotta roof.  At the bottom edge of the sheet is a small plan showing a structure with double columns.  It is possibly this same building, but two columns are not visible in the elevation.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with sketches of the details of the bridge.  At center is a plan view of the bridge's decorative moldings and balustrade.  Above are sketeches of three  bridge columns with modified leaf and scroll capitals.  At lower left is an elevation of the pointed arch between the bridge columns, with a scale of the drawings below.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a large, triple-bay masonry edifice with a round arched entrance at center, flanked by two blind niches with round arched openings above.  The second level has three small square windows with small cornice and ruined space above with only columns standing.  Below left is a sketch of the interior of a public bath.  There is a large pool in the center of a rectangular space that is encircled by a colonnade.  At the far end of the room are two round arched openings.   At right is a plan view of a groin vaulted space, a rectangular colonnaded room with small arched bays around the perimeter, and another colonnaded rectangular room to the right.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Depicted is an elevation view of a wrought iron gate rendered in slate blue wash.  The gate is composed of elaborate configurations of scrolling elements joined together by small straps of iron.  Below this is a larger, detailed view of the gate's scrolling elements and attachment points to the larger frame.  At left is an iron cross with an open quatrefoil at the crossing. The arms terminate in a stylized lily or fleur-de-lis.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a street looking toward the buildings of a medieval town.  The road is flanked by very lightly sketched three-story buildings with only the shadows colored with wash.  At the end of the street are turreted masonry buildings and a green hill with trees behind them. These buildings and the sky above have been colored.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Sheet has been cut down to vertical rectangle orientation.  Depicted is a lantern mounted to an ashlar masonry wall.  The lantern is seen from the corner and two sides are visible.  Each side has a rectangular opening that seems as though it is filled with small green glass roundels.  Above is a small row of open quatrefoils.  There is a small finial below and a small crenellated steeple-like cone for ventilation above.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick white wove paper mounted to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Dimensions
value: 16.1 x 12.6 cm (6 5/16 x 4 15/16 in.), irregular; mount: 31.9 x 24.9 cm (12 9/16 x 9 13/16 in.), irregular

label: Description
value: Sheet cut down to a vertical rectangle depicting a fountain in elevation.  The basin consists of two plinths.  The fountain spouts water from three sides of a column, upon which rests another smaller basin.  At the top is a small figure that spouts water.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on off-white wove paper mounted to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Dimensions
value: 15.3 x 13.2 cm (6 x 5 3/16 in.), irregular; mount: 31.9 x 24.9 cm (12 9/16 x 9 13/16 in.), irregular
Loggia del Papa o dei Nobile (Loggia of the Pope or the Nobility), Siena, Italy

label: Description
value: The elevation is shown at left; upper right, the plan, showing in the left half the floor and the right half the ceiling.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Description
value: Sheet cut down to make a rectangle slightly larger in width than height.  Depicted is a stone, carved well head with Christian iconography.  The well is in the shape of a capital.  It is raised on a small square plinth with canted corners.  The main sculptural composition consists of two figures kneeling, their arms resting on one bent knee to support a cross inscribed within two circles, like a Greek cross. There is a small diamond-pattern molding above.  The well appears to have a two-sided cover that hinges in the middle and, when opened, the cover rests against an ironwork scroll.  A chain hangs over the edge of the well on the right.  At the bottom left is the well head in plan view.  A scale is indicated for each sketch.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on textured thick white wove paper mounted to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Dimensions
value: 14.4 x 16 cm (5 11/16 x 6 5/16 in.), irregular; mount: 31.9 x 24.9 cm (12 9/16 x 9 13/16 in.), irregular

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet cut down and attached to top half of mount.  Depicted is a classically ornamented sarcophagus seen in elevation from the front and side.  The sarcophagus has a very high base with a panel above of carved vegetal swags tied to the corners by carved ribbons.  In the upper center of the panel is a small plaque that reads: LVSIENAE / PRIMICENIAE / VIX  ANN XXV.  The cover has a large triangular pediment with two confronted scrolls joined at the apex.  The ends of the scrolls extend high above the corners of the pediment.  The elevation of the sarcophagus at right shows a panel with a garland suspended from the top corners.  Above the ends of the cover are seen as two bellflowers end to end.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and wash, pen and black and red ink, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Dimensions
value: 14.7 x 24.5 cm (5 13/16 x 9 5/8 in.), irregular; mount: 31.9 x 24.6 cm (12 9/16 x 9 11/16 in.), irregular
Palazzo, Venice, Drawn by an Englishman

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet cut down depicting architectural details of a palazzo.  At left, baluster is shown in elevation and in plan below.  To the right is a cross-section of the balustrade and a molding detail below.  At right is the top of a column and capital that supports an arch.  To the right of this, the profile of a column base and capital are drawn.  At the bottom right are a newel and circular staircase as well as the newel post at the top of a staircase.  The scale of the drawings is given at lower left.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on buff wove paper mounted to off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Dimensions
value: 17.1 x 24.7 cm (6 3/4 x 9 3/4 in.), irregular; mount: 31.9 x 24.6 cm (12 9/16 x 9 11/16 in.), irregular
Paving of Porch, San Bernardino, Perugia

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Plan view of the patterns of a tilework pavement, colored in a light terra cotta color.   Graphite lines create a diamond pattern at rectangular diamond pattern at left.  To the right of this is a small border of single diamonds that frame cusped, four-armed tiles in the same color.  Above this is a small rectangular section with inscribed circles that the artist has used to lay out a pattern of trefoils radiating out from a central element.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet mounted horizontally and tipped into binding.  View of a large masonry building with multiple stories divided by stringcourses, and with a picturesque roofline of steeply pitched roof and a tall cupola.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on off-white wove paper, mounted to off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Dimensions
value: 21.1 x 12.4 cm (8 5/16 x 4 7/8 in.), irregular; mount: 32 x 24.9 cm (12 5/8 x 9 13/16 in.), irregular

value: Vertical sheet depicting the corner of the Moulin de la Galette, with the two windmills visible above the low timbered buildings.  At the corner is the round-arched entrance to the Bal d'Ebray where two figures stand in the doorway.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite off-white wove paper, mounted to off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

Turret, Gable & Chimney, Hôtel de Sens

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a windowed turret with pointed steeple seen from below.  Above this is the gable and chimney of the same building.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on blue paper, mounted to off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Dimensions
value: 21.1 x 12.8 cm (8 5/16 x 5 1/16 in.), irregular; mount: 32 x 24.5 cm (12 5/8 x 9 5/8 in.), irregular

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a large masonry building with turret supported by a buttress on its right side. The building seems to be late medieval or early Renaissance with it stall pitched tiled roof.  Visible at the rear of the building is an arched opening through which passes a walkway.  This area is lined by a railing.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet illustrating sketches of buildings or architectural details in the town of Laon, including the Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Laon seen from the southwest, a stair turret, one of the town gates, and a small tile-roof house with two chimneys at either end.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet illustrating a complex of three towers with faceted sides.  The towers are surrounded by trees and seen from the valley of a hill that slopes away from the side of the towers.
